title: Foundation: Passion and Basic Kitchen Skills
description: After G.C.E. O/L, the most important foundation is a passion for food and cooking. Start by learning basic cooking techniques, kitchen hygiene, and knife skills at home or through a basic course.
institutes: Basic courses at local culinary schools

title: Formal Culinary Training & Certification
description: Enroll in a professional culinary arts program. This will provide structured training in various cuisines, pastry arts, and kitchen management. Aim for a recognized diploma and NVQ qualification.
institutes: SLITHM (Sri Lanka Institute of Tourism & Hotel Management)

title: Commis Chef to Chef de Partie
description: Start your career at the bottom of the kitchen hierarchy (Commis 3) and work your way up. You will work in a specific section of the kitchen (e.g., sauces, vegetables, pastry) under a Chef de Partie (Station Chef), mastering the skills of that station.

title: Sous Chef (Second-in-Command)
description: As a Sous Chef, you are the deputy to the Head Chef. You will be responsible for day-to-day kitchen management, supervising staff, managing inventory, ensuring quality control, and stepping in for the Head Chef when needed.
qualifications: Extensive experience as a Chef de Partie

title: Executive Chef / Own Restaurant
description: Reach the pinnacle of the kitchen profession as the Executive Chef, responsible for the entire culinary operation, including menu creation, budgeting, staffing, and maintaining the restaurant's reputation. Many chefs at this level also venture to open their own restaurants.
